intro: Dimacria tenella, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy appearance with narrow, linear leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and are often used in traditional medicine. Dimacria tenella is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in sandy soils.
